ZmaxHeadband module

class ZmaxHeadband.ZmaxDataID(value)

Bases: Enum

Enumerating each data signal with a specific number.

bat = 6

The assigned number to battery levels.

bodytemp = 5

The assigned number to body temperature data.

dx = 2

The assigned number to acceleration in x direction of the IMU.

dy = 3

The assigned number to acceleration in y direction of the IMU.

dz = 4

The assigned number to acceleration in z direction of the IMU.

eegl = 1

The assigned number to EEG L channel

eegr = 0

The assigned number to EEG R channel

light = 8

The assigned number to ambient light data.

nasal_l = 9

The assigned number to the left nasal channel.

nasal_r = 10

The assigned number to the right nasal channel.

noise = 7

The assigned number to noise/microphone data.

oxy_dark_ac = 13
oxy_dark_dc = 16
oxy_ir_ac = 11
oxy_ir_dc = 14
oxy_r_ac = 12
oxy_r_dc = 15
class ZmaxHeadband.ZmaxHeadband

Bases: object

BatteryVoltage(vbat)

The battery voltage data

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • vbat – The word to be converted to battery voltage (v)

Returns

t (temperature)

BodyTemp(bodytemp)

The body temperature data.

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • bodytemp – The temperature in words (to be converted to degrees)

Returns

t (temperature)

ScaleAccel(dx)

Scale the acceleration value with respecto to the gravity (g).

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • dx – word value to be converted to ‘g’ scale

ScaleEEG(e)

Scale the EEG data by receiving the word and converting it to uV.

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • e – word to convert

Returns

d

dec2hex(n, pad=0)

return the hexadecimal string representation of integer ‘n’

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • n – string value

  • pad – padding

Returns

s.rjust(pad, ‘0’)

getbyteat(buf, idx=0)

Receiving the bytes of data.

for example getbyteat(“08-80-56-7F-EA”,0) -> hex2dec(08)

getbyteat(“08-80-56-7F-EA”,2) -> hex2dec(56)

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • buf – the data buffer.

  • idx – the index of the data (indicating the data type).

Returns

self.hex2dec(s)

Get the word

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • buf – the data buffer.

  • idx – the index of the data (indicating the data type).

Returns

w

hex2dec(s)

Return the integer value of a hexadecimal string ‘s’.

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • s – string value

Returns

int(s, 16)

read(reqIDs=[0, 1])

Reading the signal from ZmaxDataID class.

output refers to a list of the desired outputs of the function for example [0,1,3] returns [eegl, eegr, dy] [0=eegr, 1=eegl, 2=dx, 3=dy, 4=dz, 5=bodytemp, 6=bat, 7=noise, 8=light, 9=nasal_l, 10=nasal_r, 11=oxy_ir_ac,

12=oxy_r_ac, 13=oxy_dark_ac, 14=oxy_ir_dc, 15=oxy_r_dc, 16=oxy_dark_dc]

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • reqIDs – The ID of the data to record.

Returns

reqVals

stimulate(rgb1=(0, 0, 2), rgb2=(0, 0, 2), pwm1=254, pwm2=0, t1=1, t2=3, reps=5, vib=1, alt=0)

Stimulation trigger.

example: LIVEMODE_SENDBYTES 15 6 111 04-00-00-02-00-00-02-FE-00-01-03-05-01-00

command = “LIVEMODE_SENDBYTES” retries = 15 msgn = 6 retry_ms = 111 LIVECMD_FLASHLEDS = 04 r = 00 g = 00 b = 02 r2 = 00 g2 = 00 b2 = 02 pwm1 = FE (254); intensity from 2(1%) to 254(100%) pwm2 = 00 t1 = 01 t2 = 03 reps = 05 vib = 01 alt = 00 # althernate eyes

Parameters

  • self – access the attributes and methods of the class

  • rgb1 – rgb value 1

  • rgb2 – rgb value 2

  • pwm1 – ON intensity

  • pwm2 – OFF intensity

  • t1 – time ON

  • t2 – time OFF

  • reps – number of blinks/ repititions

  • vib – Vibration triggering

  • alt – Alternating the LEDs

ZmaxHeadband.connect()

Initiate the connection by calling a ZmaxSocket object.

Parameters

None – no input

Returns

socket
